subject: Management
title: Leading With Empathy
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Leading With Empathy.

hook.text: A CEO announced layoffs with a PowerPoint deck of efficiency metrics. No acknowledgment of pain. Trust evaporated.

buildup.text: Change leaders focus on logic: here's why this makes sense. But people experience change emotionally.

discovery.text: Empathetic leadership: acknowledging difficulty before presenting solutions. Feel first, fix second.

twist.text: Empathy doesn't slow change down. It speeds it up because people feel heard and move forward faster.

climax.text: Start with: I know this is hard. I understand what you're losing. Then explain the path forward.

punchline.text: Acknowledge the pain first. Then people can hear the plan.

quiz.question: Why is empathy important when leading change?
options: People who feel heard process change faster and commit more fully
Empathy slows down the change process and should be minimized
Only logical arguments matter when convincing people to change
